page.title: 06THE CHURCH,DUNTISBOURNE
page.content: In Duntisbourne Abbots the church,St Peter's,is in the centre of the village on a higher level overlooking the valley of the Dunt.The cream lychgate ,on a central pivot, is particularly interesting .A tree-lined path takes you up to the church door. People said church attendance was not high ,except for a few regulars. A Methodist chapel in the village is now a garage.In the graveyard , the stones are unusual because most of the inscriptions are inscribed on oval plaques instead of on the stone itself.This has meant that many inscriptions are still legible after 200 years.There are also daisies and roses growing around the churchyard which add to the picturesque sight.In the tower are 3 bells and a Medieval bell-frame.The Church building itself is mainly Norman.
